Truncated Multivariate Normal Simulation

Wen-Ting Wang

2024-08-27

Source: vignettes/truncated_multivariate_normal_simulation.Rmd
truncated_multivariate_normal_simulation.Rmd

Summary

This vignette demonstrates the simulation and visualization of multivariate normal and truncated multivariate normal data using Matern covariance functions. We define a grid of locations, apply basis functions to generate mean functions, and simulate both non-truncated and truncated multivariate normal samples.

Data Generation Formula

  1. Multivariate Normal Distribution: Y(𝐬)∼MVN(μ(𝐬),Σ) Y(\mathbf{s}) \sim \text{MVN}(\mu(\mathbf{s}), \Sigma) where:
    • μ(𝐬)=β⋅ϕ(𝐬)\mu(\mathbf{s}) = \beta \cdot \phi(\mathbf{s})
    • Basis Function: ϕ(𝐬)=cos((s1−0)2+(s2−1)2×π)\phi(\mathbf{s}) = \cos(\sqrt{(s_1 - 0)^2 + (s_2 - 1)^2} \times \pi)
    • Coefficient: β=5\beta = 5
    • Matern Covariance (Σ\Sigma) Parameters:
      • σ2=1\sigma^2 = 1
      • ρ=0.2\rho = 0.2
      • ν=1.5\nu = 1.5
  2. Truncated Multivariate Normal Distribution: Y(𝐬)∼Truncated MVN(μ(𝐬),Σ,a(𝐬),b(𝐬)) Y(\mathbf{s}) \sim \text{Truncated MVN}(\mu(\mathbf{s}), \Sigma, a(\mathbf{s}), b(\mathbf{s})) with the same μ(𝐬)\mu(\mathbf{s}) and Σ\Sigma as above, and:
    • Truncation Bounds: [−5,5][-5, 5]

Define Matern Covariance Function
